comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of March 22, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50F1FFB385F13738... indicates that Brown and Gardner played for the national amateur 18.2 balkline billiard championship. Edward W. Gardner won. Gardner also beat Brown on March 10, 1914, according to next day's NYT query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50C11FC3D5E13738... The game appears to be billiards (two white balls and a red ball) rather than pool.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Billiard champion Morris D. Brown recovered his rep in April, defeating Joseph Mayer for the Interstate Challenge Cup: New York Times story, April 10, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9C0CE2D91E39E6...

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started and entry for him in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morris_D._Brown
